newsitem.title: USA: LL&E enters development pact in Algeria.
newsitem.headline: LL&E enters development pact in Algeria.

text.p: The Louisiana Land and Exploration Co and Talisman Energy Inc said on Tuesday they reached a development agreement with Algeria's Sonatrach in the ORD/BKE field.

"We look forward to working with our partners in submitting the plan of development for the field to the Algerian government before mid-year 1997," H. Leighton Steward, LL&E's chairman, president and chief executive, said in a statement.
LL&E said the agreements signed on February 7, 1997, are for Block 405, Block 406A and Block 404A, the companies said in a joint statement.

LL&E has a 65 percent working interest in Block 405 with Talisman holding 35 percent under a 1993 production sharing contract with Sonatrach, the companies siad. LL&E and Talisman are entitled to recover exploration costs out of production during the exploitation phase, the companies said.
In addition to participating in the development of the ORD/BKE Field, LL&E and Talisman are appraising the MLN Field approximately 26 kilometers (16.1 miles) to the southeast.
The MLN-1 discovery well tested in July 1996 at a daily rate of 15,850 barrels of oil and 61 million cubic feet of natural gas, the companies said.

A delineation well, MLN-2, approximately 2 kilometers (1.2 miles) north-northwest of the discovery well tested at a daily rate of 3,400 barrels of oil and 9 million cubic feet of natural gas in December 1996, the companies said.
A second delineation well, MLN-3, is currently drilling at a location approximately 5 kilometers (3.1 miles) north-northeast of the discovery well, LL&E and Talisman said.
In 1997, LL&E and Talisman said they are concluding a 835 kilometer seismic acquisition program on Block 405 to better define exploratory leads on the block.
A second drilling rig is being secured to drill the first exploratory well on Block 215 in early spring, the companies said.
